meta.title: TCP Client using Eclipse Vert.x, Kotlin and Gradle build
meta.summary: In this blog post, I demonstrate how to write a very simple TCP client that keeps a connection open to a custom-written server in cloud.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x based Framework URL Shortener Backend
meta.summary: We combine Vert.x with the serverless framework to write a microservice that runs on AWS Lambda.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x meets GraphQL
meta.summary: In this blog post, we will look at an example application written in Vert.x that uses the new GraphQL API of Gentics Mesh.

meta.title: Centralized logging for Vert.x applications using the ELK stack
meta.summary: This post entry describes a solution to achieve centralized logging of Vert.x applications using the ELK stack (Logstash, Elasticsearch, and Kibana).

meta.title: Things to keep in mind concerning CSRF attacks
meta.summary: Eclipse Vert.x like most frameworks provides an anti-CSRF defense. However, no framework can prevent all attack vectors that exist in the web. Therefore, developers need to be aware of some dangers and common attack vectors concerning CSRF defenses.

meta.title: Using the asynchronous SQL client
meta.summary: Finally, back... This post is the fifth post of the introduction to vert.x blog series, after a not-that-small break. In this post we are going to see how we can use JDBC in a vert.x application.
